newsitem.title: USA: AlliedSignal to buy Grimes Aerospace.
newsitem.headline: AlliedSignal to buy Grimes Aerospace.

text.p: AlliedSignal Inc said Wednesday it had agreed to buy Grimes Aerospace from an affiliate of the investment firm Forstmann Little & Co for an undisclosed sum.
AlliedSignal said in a news release that it expects the acquisition to be non-dilutive to earnings in 1997 and to contribute to earnings beginning in 1998.
Grimes, which makes aircraft lighting systems, has annual sales of about $230 million.

Grimes's customers include Boeing Co, Airbus Industrie and other aerospace companies, as well as commercial airlines. Grimes employees 1,400 people worldwide, with primary facilities in Connecticut, Florida, South Carolina and Ohio.
AlliedSignal is a technology and manufacturing company. Its AlliedSignal Aerospace unit makes propulsion engines, auxiliary power units and other aerospace equipment.
